newsitem.title: PANAMA: Panama police seize 1.5 tons of cocaine.
newsitem.headline: Panama police seize 1.5 tons of cocaine.

text.p: Panama's anti-narcotics police seized nearly 1.5 tons of cocaine, in the largest drug haul this year, authorities said on Thursday.

The police arrested five Panamanians when they seized most of the drugs late on Wednesday in a van parked outside the free-trade zone in Colon, 50 miles (80 km) from Panama City on the Atlantic Coast. The rest was found on Thursday in a car parked outside a home in Panama City.
"This was the biggest drug bust of the year," a spokeswoman for the Technical Judicial Police (PTJ) said.

PTJ chief Alejandro Moncada told a news conference the detained people likely belonged to an international drug ring that shipped drugs from Panama's Atlantic Coast to a Caribbean island, and then on to the United States.
He said cocaine busts were expected to rise in Panama this year. "So far this year we've seized some 4 tons of cocaine. In all of last year, we seized more than 8 tons of cocaine."
He attributed the increase in busts to closer cooperation among customs, police anti-drug units and maritime officials.
